results.title: Doctor Who & the Daleks
results.brief_description: The Doctor (Peter Cushing), with his two granddaughters, Barbara and Susan, and Barbara’s bumbling boyfriend, Ian, accidently set off on a journey through time in the Tardis- destination unknown. Landing on a planet of gloomy surroundings they come across the Daleks who are searching for a cure to protect them from radiation sickness- of which their planet is saturated. The other inhabitants of the planet, the Thal, have a drug to cure radition sickness and the Daleks will stop at nothing to obtain the information. A colourful, comical and serious film adaptation of the popular long running television serial. Starring Peter Cushing, Roberta Tovey, Jennie Linden and Ray Castle.

results.title: Doctor Jekyll and sister Hyde
results.creator_credit: Roy Baker, Brian Clemens, Albert Fennell and Hammer
results.brief_description: This unusual twist on Robert Louis Stevenson’s often filmed Doctor Jekyll and Mr Hyde also incorporates the Jack the Ripper mythology into it’s narrative. This time around the ‘good’ doctor Jekyll (Ralph Bates) is experimenting with female hormones in his quest for the elixir of youth, when things start to go horribly wrong. His experiment transforms him not into a hideous monster but a beautiful woman (Martine Beswick), giving the film an unexpected gender-bending twist. Of course the doctor spends much of his time in front of the mirror admiring his new breasts, while the upkeep of his new persona sends him into a grisly killing spree. Cast includes Gerald Sim, Lewis Fiander, Susan Broderick, Dorothy Alison.

results.title: Doctor Dolittle (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Richard Fleischer, Arthur P. Jacobs and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: This is a charming fantasy excursion which creates a wonderful world of endless imagination through music, dance and special effects. Rex Harrison stars in the madcap adventures of a 19th century English doctor who walks and talks and squarks with the animals. Based on the stories of Hugh Lofting, the good doctor gets himself into all sorts of funny predicaments in this fun film that earned an Academy Award nomination for Best Picture. With terrific music, fine acting, loveable creatures and a joyous fantasy tale, “Doctor Doolittle” is a classic for young and old alike.

results.title: Doctor De Soto (K)
results.creator_credit: Michael Sporn, Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: Doctor De Soto, a mouse dentist, refuses to treat animals that are “dangerous” to mice, until one day a fox shows up writhing in pain from a toothache. How Doctor De Soto and his assistant, Mrs De Soto, “outfox the fox” is a humorous story.

results.title: Dockside
results.brief_description: Three major sequences deal with current developments in cargo handling; the giant cranes that take containerized cargo from hold to truck trailer, conveyer slings and belts that speed cartons, and the unloading of automobiles in a breathtaking aerial ballet. Shows the rich swirl of human activity around a port.

results.title: Doc: a Portrait of Herbert Vere Evatt, 1894-1965
results.creator_credit: Pat Fiske, David McKnight, Denise Haslem, Film Australia and National Film and Sound Archive of Australia
results.brief_description: Known as “the Doc”, Evatt was an idealist, internationalist, a lawyer and a politician. He was the only Australian elected as President of the United Nations (1948) and the decisions he handed down as a High Court Judge had lasting effects on the course of Australian political history. Evatt fought to defeat an attempt to ban the Communist Party, only to find that his own party, the Australian Labor Party was deeply divided on the issue and his contentious role in 1950’s politics overshadows his many notable achievements. This excellent documentary blends commentary, newsreel footage and interviews with historians, family and public figures to offer a rare and moving insight into the life of one of Australia’s most notable political figures.

results.title: Do you think you can manage? (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Michael Darlow, Robert Reid and Video Arts
results.brief_description: A training film for office supervisors and their managers. Explores in personal and human terms the problems which can arise when a clerk is promoted, unprepared for a supervisory job, and suggests some basic and simple methods by which they can be avoided.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Darlow, Robert Reid and Video Arts

results.title: Do you remember?
results.creator_credit: Tony Thompson and British Transport Films
results.brief_description: Day in, day out, throughout the year, the passengers on London’s buses and Underground leave behind them enough property to keep a large staff of sorters and storemen permanently busy. How the lost property is collected, sorted, ware-housed and, in most cases, restored to owners is the story of this film.
